column1: Glad to be a part of today’s #COVID19 educational and testing outreach event at Tudor Ranch for farm workers. Thank you to @DesertHealthCV Riverside County Public Health Vision y Compromiso @TODEC1 and Growing Coachella Valley for organizing this event. https://t.co/O4KYia8ckr

When you wear a mask you protect yourself and others from #COVID19. Here's how to wear your mask the right way:   ✅Wash your hands before and after touching the mask. ✅Make sure your mask covers your nose mouth and chin. ✅Wash reusable masks after each use.
Me senté con @JulioVaqueiro y @Telemundo para discutir las últimas noticias sobre una vacuna contra el COVID-19. Más aquí. ⬇️ https://t.co/mEB9qjo7gL

Want to know where you can get tested for #COVID19? Riverside County Department of Public Health has tools to help you locate a testing site near you. Follow the link below for information on where you can get tested and answers to your testing FAQs.   https://t.co/wMKbt9mNWw

From day 1 I have warned about the devastation COVID will have and is having on the farmworker community. So glad to partner with the Coachella Valley Volunteers in Medicine on the amazing work they and others are doing. So much more to do. https://t.co/T9bQrKnMnZ

We all have a patriotic duty to continue taking precautions to fight the spread of #COVID19. Make sure you:  😷 Wear your mask.  👐 Wash your hands.  🧍➡️🧍 Maintain your distance.   https://t.co/nHccKfKACN

When you #MaskUp you're helping protect those around you from #COVID19. As we face a new surge in coronavirus cases in our communities it's critical we all do our part to slow the spread. https://t.co/AuAs28t0Yg

Today we have reached a tragic milestone. My heart goes out to the families of the 18000 Californians we have lost to COVID-19. As we enter the holiday season it is critical that we all work together to fight the coronavirus pandemic.   https://t.co/GLbtGqNOwK

.@TODEC1 is offering housing and financial assistance to protect essential farmworkers during the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more about the program and if you qualify by calling ​1-888-863-3291 or going online to: https://t.co/TdbyOzsasO.    https://t.co/Cla3r5eAaS

The coronavirus is causing a rapid rise in hospitalizations here in our Valley. We must take this surge seriously & do our part to slow the spread by wearing a mask staying at least six feet from others avoiding gatherings and washing our hands often.   https://t.co/OocccM8jno

🚨 Happening now! 🚨   @CityofCoachella and Central Neighborhood Health Foundation are offering FREE COVID-19 tests and flu shots at Bagdouma Park until 4 pm PT. Make an appointment and find out more here:  https://t.co/OXMC0zuF9j

Fall season is upon us and the coronavirus is starting to surge again as predicted. Wear your mask wash your hands stay at least six feet from others in public and continue to take necessary precautions to protect the health of our community.  https://t.co/pbC1li98Ea

We all have a role to play in slowing the spread of #COVID19. Here's how you wear your mask the right way:   ✅Wash your hands before and after touching the mask.  ✅Make sure your mask covers your nose mouth and chin.  ✅Wash reusable masks after each use. https://t.co/2ea1RpGEO8

Riverside County is offering extended hours for #COVID19 testing. Follow the link below to find out where you can get tested and make an appointment at https://t.co/2VhGuLL8pR.   https://t.co/TqN78ZXZsF

Attention small business owners in #CA36!📣  Riverside County is now accepting applications for its COVID-19 Small Business Grant. Learn more about this #CARESAct program and if your business qualifies here:   https://t.co/XsyzJUSlHV

Día de los Muertos is a day to remember and honor the lives of those who have passed. Today I'm remembering our loved ones friends and neighbors we have lost to COVID-19 at @SunnylandsNews and @PSArtMuseum’s Día de los Muertos exhibition. https://t.co/2zr8MJrJ24

Este año es especialmente importante tener un lugar de reflexión para los 1200 residentes del Condado de Riverside que han fallecido de COVID-19. En la celebración del Día de los Muertos con @PSArtMuseum recordaremos a nuestros seres queridos que hemos perdido. https://t.co/EhMxWxTUtR

Anxiety and depression are on the rise. It is critical that we improve access to mental health care during the #COVID19 pandemic and beyond.    If you are struggling with mental health challenges visit https://t.co/oY7jt8W49L.  https://t.co/7ZthNm6znr

Día de los Muertos is a day to remember those who have passed by celebrating their lives. This year @PSArtMuseum will offer a place of reflection for the 1200+ Riverside County residents who have died from COVID-19.   https://t.co/UMnpbMMide https://t.co/uGxt7WzOqW

The #COVID19 pandemic is fueling the housing crisis and millions of Americans are facing eviction. When it comes to eviction protections it's critical that you #KnowYourRights. Visit https://t.co/VQD0oNXheH for more information. https://t.co/dCbz5AQAQp

Farmworkers working through this pandemic to put food on our tables have been disproportionately impacted by #COVID19. We must protect them and their families to beat the coronavirus.   https://t.co/f0debxJCE4
Wearing a mask the right way can help protect those around you from #COVID19. Love your neighbor and #MaskUp. https://t.co/BXxTXOmxiY

Thank you @HouseDemocrats @ClimateCrisis and @HispanicCaucus for holding today's discussion on the impact of #COVID19 on environmental justice communities. Let's keep working together to create a healthier America for everyone – regardless of zip code race or status. https://t.co/U2ZMCxhCng

Yesterday I spoke with businesses who are developing a COVID-19 vaccine and told them we must hold the Administration's feet to the fire to make sure there is a plan for equitable distribution. https://t.co/Q0rBUY1BQ5

When you #MaskUp you're helping protect those around you from #COVID19. https://t.co/1TmheyW0ED
🔔 Reminder 🔔 There is free COVID testing available at the Palm Springs Convention Center starting TODAY and ending October 14. Make an appointment here: https://t.co/7Qxsuw5ZxW

I worked hard to make sure my bill the Care for COVID-19 2.0 Act was included in the new version of the #HeroesAct because costs should not be a barrier for people to get the care they need to survive #COVID19. https://t.co/GcLhvN1occ
Free COVID-19 testing will be available at the Palm Springs Convention Center on October 12 – 14 through the Riverside University Health System. To make an appointment visit: https://t.co/7Qxsuw5ZxW

Farmworkers working through this pandemic to put food on our tables are at high risk of getting COVID-19 and dying from the disease. We must fight so all essential workers are protected on the job and paid fairly. #EssentialNotDisposable #HHM   https://t.co/At19GNCulq

At yesterday's @HispanicCaucus meeting with Dr. Fauci I asked how the White House plans to prioritize health equity in the distribution of a COVID-19 vaccine. See his response here. ⬇ https://t.co/1Kne1WFZVn

We need a public health approach to vaccine distribution that is fair effective and prioritizes vulnerable populations who are at the highest risk of getting infected and dying from #COVID19. https://t.co/YW2iznwz5D

As we enter a new phase of the #COVID19 pandemic this fall we must prepare for the worst as we work for the best. I voted for the bipartisan COVID PREPARE Act to ensure our nation's pandemic response is transparent and fully meets the needs of the American people.

Diversity in the trial phase is key to ensuring a safe effective #COVID19 vaccine for ALL Americans. To truly achieve #HealthEquity we need robust representation in the trial phase and an equitable distribution plan. #HHM  https://t.co/YoaNMpNjHz

Our community's locally owned restaurants have been hit hard by the #COVID19 pandemic. That's why I'm advocating for legislation like the RESTAURANTS Act to be included in pandemic relief negotiations to help our local restaurants service industry & economy. #SmallBusinessWeek

The Strengthening America’s Strategic National Stockpile Act will spur domestic manufacturing of the supplies we need to fight the #COVID19 pandemic. I'm glad to have voted for this much-needed legislation and I urge the Senate to take it up for a vote immediately!

Our nation has reached another tragic milestone: 200000 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19. As we mourn the people we have lost we must renew our commitment to fighting this pandemic and do our patriotic duty to protect those around us.  https://t.co/DHFfWM5Q78
.@lift_rise is offering rental assistance to Riverside County residents impacted by #COVID19. Read more about the application process and if you qualify here:   https://t.co/CJ1IgjByK9
Health equity must be a priority – not an afterthought – in the national allocation and distribution plan for a #COVID19 vaccine.  https://t.co/aVk0zgFyTZ

Today I voted for the bipartisan Ensuring Children and Child Care Workers Are Safe Act to equip childcare providers and workers with the resources they need to prevent the spread of #COVID19 and keep our families safe.

Access to mental health treatment was already unacceptably low when the pandemic hit and #COVID19 has put an even greater strain on that system. That's one of the reasons we need my bill the Improving Mental Health Access from the Emergency Department Act. https://t.co/kHWsixnJVt

Mañana @TODEC1 distribuirá mascarillas y guantes gratis de 9 am a 10 am PT para ayudar a prevenir la propagación de #COVID19. Visite https://t.co/UixwsoHiYn para obtener más información. https://t.co/CXwXkbQXeK

To make sure your vote gets counted vote early – either by mail or in person! Check out CA's policy on #VoteByMail or early in-person voting and make sure you have a plan to cast your ballot safely during #COVID19. https://t.co/zrBkQ2iry9 https://t.co/xQdvkn7QLF
Sus acciones pueden salvar vidas. Protéjase y proteja a los demás del COVID-19 y use una mascarilla. https://t.co/00v8UFHkbZ

I met Martha at our last #COVID19 testing event in Thermal. At 75 years old she has worked in the fields for more than 15 years picking crops to feed America. It's stories like Martha’s that inspire me and give me strength.  Martha gracias por tu fuerza y arduo trabajo. https://t.co/WCntj1iehM
